lead_paragraph: The Trump campaign, desperate for a winning political issue in the final two weeks of the race, mounted an offensive against the Affordable Care Act.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and ABBY GOODNOUGH

headline.print_headline: Growing Costs of Health Law  Pose a Late Test
headline.main: Seizing on Rising Costs, Trump Says Health Law Is ‘Over’

snippet: The Trump campaign, desperate for a winning political issue in the final two weeks of the race, mounted an offensive against the Affordable Care Act....
abstract: Donald Trump, reaching for political issue to give him advantage in remaining weeks of presidential race, attacks Hillary Clinton over premium increases that will affect some Americans covered under Affordable Care Act; Trump immediately undercuts his message, however, by appearing uncertain about workings of health law and impending rate increases.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
